moreBlocks.lawyersAtWhitleyLawFirmSelectedForASuper: • Whitley, Robert E. On a Super Lawyers® List

description:
At the Whitley Law Firm, family is important to us. Located in Greenville, North Carolina, we are dedicated to protecting the rights of injured clients and reducing the stress and fear families feel when one is dealing with a personal injury. We accept cases throughout the state.

Clients appreciate the intimate, boutique setting of our law firm. With numerous attorneys who are passionate about personal injury law and continuing to develop their education and skills in the field, we are uniquely suited to provide the right match for legal representation for any type of injury. Our team has more than 80 years of combined experience, with attorneys who have received the highest recognition of AV Preeminent* by Martindale-Hubbell, a peer-rated service for distinguishing impeccable legal standards and commitment to customer service.

Our personal injury experience includes motor vehicle accidents, motorcycle injuries, truck accidents, pedestrian accidents, dangerous drug litigation, construction accidents, medical malpractice, defective medical devices, dog bites, premises liability, hazardous products, nursing home abuse and wrongful death. We are also skilled in assisting clients in seeking workers' compensation and Social Security Disability benefits, as well as addressing appeals for a denied claim.

We have helped thousands of clients on the path to recovery and an improved life at the Whitley Law Firm. We believe in giving personal injury victims the same kind of treatment we would want for our own family members. Clients are offered a complementary initial consultation at our office to discuss their case, answer questions and develop the best strategy for success.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review Rating falls into two categories: legal ability and general ethical standards.
